text: Cheste (Valencian: Xest) is a city in Spain. It is in the Valencian Community. It is west of Valencia and about east of Madrid. It covers . In 2008, 8,127 people lived there according to the National Institute of Statistics census. == Demography == Population over timeSource: Población de hecho según el Instituto Nacional de Estadística de España (Population de facto according the INE census). Alteraciones de los municipios en los Censos de Población desde 1842, Series de población de los municipios de España desde 1996. 1857 1887 1900 1910 1920 1930 1940 1950 1960 1970 1981 1991 1996 2001 2006 2007 Population 4,732 5,548 6,039 5,826 6,110 5,101 5,100 5,210 5,221 5,966 7,424 6,726 6,857 7,027 7,425 7,872 == Economy == Cheste's main industry is agriculture, specifically the vineyards. Cheste is also known for the MotoGP's Circuit Ricardo Tormo, built in 1999. == References == == Other websites== * Cheste's city hall website Category:Cities in the Valencian Community Category:Municipalities in the Valencian Community
